message.content:
{"id": "129561", "title": "Bug 129561HCGBIDI: Undesirable generation of SQL query elements", "description": "Bug 129561HCGBIDI: Undesirable generation of SQL query elements. This is not only an NLS-specific defect but also occurs when a table name includes a blank in this database. When selecting 'Preview Results', an exception is fired. The expected result should be to get something like 'select USER.Table Name.Column Name'.", "OB": "When creating a table with a name that includes a blank in this database and selecting 'Preview Results', an exception is fired.", "EB": "You should get something like 'select USER.Table Name.Column Name' when creating a table with a name that includes a blank in this database and selecting 'Preview Results'.", "SR": "To reproduce the issue:
1. Create a DB2 database.
2. Make sure it has a column with a name that includes a blank.
3. Create a Data Source based on the DB from step 1.
4. Create a Data Set based on the table from Step 2.
5. On the Query screen, drag and drop the column name from step 2 into the select portion of the clause.
6. Manually change the SQL query to: 'select USER.'"}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '129561', 'title': 'Bug 129561HCGBIDI: Undesirable generation of SQL query elements', 'description': 'Bug 129561HCGBIDI: Undesirable generation of SQL query elements This is not even NLS specific defect. Otherwise the query will fail.1. Create table with name including blank in this database. Select "Preview Results"Result: Exception is fired.7. "Table Name". "Column Name"8. ', 'OB': '', 'EB': 'You should get something like select USER.Table Name.Column Name6. ', 'SR': 'Create DB2 database2. Make sure it has column with name including blank as well.3. Create Data Source based on the DB from step 14. Create Data Set based on the table from Step 25. On the Query screen drag and drop the column name from step 2 into select portion of the clause. Change manualy the SQL query as follows: select USER. '}
